pullRequest.body:
This adds some more API lemmas for multiplicative characters.

---

### PR summary [be88cd8f6b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13939/commits/be88cd8f6ba552093301a6ddb9a1bd322f51be4c)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ apply_mem_algebraAdjoin`
`+ apply_mem_algebraAdjoin_of_pow_eq_one`
`+ apply_mem_rootsOfUnity`
`+ apply_mem_rootsOfUnity_of_pow_eq_one`
`+ apply_mem_rootsOfUnity_orderOf`
`+ eq_iff`
`+ equiv_rootsOfUnity`
`+ exists_apply_eq_pow`
`+ exists_mulChar_orderOf`
`+ exists_mulChar_orderOf_eq_card_units`
`+ instStarMul`
`+ ofRootOfUnity`
`+ ofRootOfUnity_spec`
`+ orderOf_dvd_card_sub_one`
`+ ringHomComp_inv`
`+ ringHomComp_mul`
`+ ringHomComp_one`
`+ ringHomComp_pow`
`+ starComp`
`+ star_apply`
`+ star_apply'`
`+ star_eq_inv`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9944688641/job/27471272879)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9944688641/job/27471273123)

`val` is usually the name component that refers to `Subtype.val`.
I think in this case `apply` is what should be used.

Idem for the `val`s in lemmas below.
OK, thanks for pointing this out!
Is it worth to add some `star...` instance to `MulChar R R'`?
That would be `StarMul`, I think. I'm adding this (and use it to simplify some of the following statements).

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(NumberTheory/MulChar): extend API for multiplicative characters
